gnE5AzlmC7LVkFBZmFkjNw.text: I came to eat Lindo Michoacan after hearing the podcast Latinos Who Lunch rave about it for over a year! The inside decor of this place is so beautiful and the ambiance of the place is really lively. I came in very hungry lol so I ordered a chile relleno and a plate of two cheese enchiladas one with green sauce and one with red and two micheladas to wash it down :) Needless to say I left happy and full!

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Came here thanks to the recommendations from the podcast Latinos Who Lunch!

AfSMrMmbj-KkzrqF9hPJLQ.text: Great service, excellent traditional Mexican food and good drinks.   My order was actually brought to me incorrect made. It was a big deal. I just didn't want pico on one of my tacos. When I mentioned it the bartender immediately took it back and I was brought a replacement taco expeditiously. Best traditional Mexican food in Las Vegas.

s1uHkuj8JHEVC6vfftaelA.text: Soooo awesome always packed have mariachis fridays and saturdays totally recommend them! Took my parents for their wedding anniversary because the food and margaritas and the whole atmosphere is amazing i love this place and highly recommend it to anyone who loves mexican authentic food !! Loved it so much later when i was in vegas i took my coworker and she loved it too!!

iInwcavTgC839xkSSVyMTg.text: My favorite Mexican restaurant ever.  We have been here many times and have never been disappointed.  I love that I don't have to jump through hoops to bring a large group of people. They always say ok and it's never a problem

Cgx0afjDnTgGZLCjoA8I8g.text: The food was amazing and the service was great but the hostess Stephanie was being very rude and disrespect while we were trying to make reservations. I would suggest getting another host.

4aq1Eo5KdY-sesQymr9BDw.text: It was a bad experience. The food was good which was the only good thing. My boyfriend and I sat there nearly the entire time being completely unacknowledged and if he hadn't said anything I think we would have been sitting there even longer. We had asked for a refill on salsa but the guy took it and must have forgotten. He never brought it. Normally that wouldn't be that big of a deal but we got our food and nobody asked how it was once or paid any attention to us. The entire time we were there. I saw other people being attended to constantly and I felt like it was rude that we were ignored the whole time and other people were getting 5 star service. We were done eating and were wanting dessert but nobody asked us until my boyfriend caught the guy's attention. We ate the dessert and then were obviously done and were wanting the check but again, nobody came to check in with us. Almost 20 minutes went by (this was the third time we were waiting for someone to just look at us) and my boyfriend stood up for about 5 minutes trying to get someone's attention and again was completely ignored. He ended up going over to the manager asking for the check. I don't know if they were biased toward us since we looked young but we always tip well when going out to eat and would have tipped a lot more if someone had paid attention to us. I felt very unwelcome and don't want to go back. I would give zero stars but the food was good. I don't think either of us deserved that and it was the worst service I've ever had and we eat out a lot. We left the restaurant and the hostess didn't look at us or say anything. I am a little upset over it.

gIlsnq6p3zfdKga7nIG0Sg.text: We went here on the advise of a friend and the good reviews.  I am not understanding what the deal is with Mexican food in Las Vegas, but it is weird.  I am from San Diego.  Totally different.  What is fideo soup?  Tasteless wattery liquid with little noodles (?).  Not an issue, just don't eat it.  Then there is the Salsa.  This is the second restaurant that has had this strange tasting salsa.  The salsa is what kills it for me.  I need salsa on my mexican food and this salsa ruined the food.  Asked if they had anything different, the answer was no.  I am sticking to Roberto's and Rubios for mexican from now on.

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZkZiX4eoSXlNmJ9pP0mulA.text: The food here is amazing!! Authentic Mexican food with great taste. The customer service was great, the staff was very friendly and out going, but it did take quite a while for our food. Overall the food was extremely satisfying.

V9fAv68RecgQcAfAfmbE6w.text: First time trying this place last night with my family... it was super busy, there was so many people waiting outside and I honestly didn't want to wait but the wait was so short because they are super quick to take people in!!   I did order the sopes plate it comes with 6 lil sopes and I thought that they were so lil that I was still going to be hungry so I also ordered a shrimp empanizado taco and let me tell you that I was soooo full by the time I finished  3 lil sopes and the shrimp taco but EVERYTHING WAS DELICIOUS highly recommend this place and there mango margaritas.

yUHBkf5L0Os_kuHQTYvP3g.text: This was my first time to Vegas and the first restaurant that I visited in Vegas. I was not disappointed. The atmosphere was great, the staff were very friendly and was great! The live entertainment was a nice touch. I would definitely recommend and rerun if I'm ever in the Vegas area again. Keep up the great work.

eafvFJ1yXs8Dat19Vlwk9w.text: Bomb! Just do it! Micheladas on point! They give you bean dip and salsa and Fideo! Waht!

cDwTK6ompUtLIaFayG4ZxQ.text: My wife and I had not been to Lindo in many years. And I do not know why!  First off, please make reservations before you go! We made the mistake of going on a Saturday afternoon at 5:30. And although the wait for us was only 20 minutes, the people behind us were just being seated when we had finished our meal. And there was a line of dozens of folks wait  Aside from the excellent selection, delicious food, and charming ambiance, the service was outstanding! Each person from Luis, the manager, Jorge the busser, and the other service staff, they all worked as a TEAM!  As soon as our water was empty, somebody filled it. As soon as a table was empty another platoon of staff came in to clean it and prepare it for the next guest.  Back to the food, my wife had the empinadas and I had the carnitas. Our meals were served quickly. They were hot and fresh. The tortillas were right off the stove and too hot to handle! There was a homemade freshness to everything.   Make your reservation, load up the family and head over to Lindo Michoacan! You will not be disappointed!

gmWwMcYMMjIYSrT5FEGTSQ.text: I have ate here 30 or 40 times. Mainly the restaurant on Desert Inn but at at the Flamingo Restaurant tonight. We ate the beef fajitas.  Fajitas were tough, very poorly seasoned and service, for this restaurant, was very poor. Don't know if it was because it was Christmas eve but it was not what I am use to. I'll probably go back, but tonight was NOT GOOD.

3Fcp9C7aNCz2n4FqAeZvgQ.text: best. mexican. food. EVER! Every time i am in Vegas we make sure to eat here, sometimes we eat here every day..no joke. This place makes my heart melt. I LOVE LINDO!

VlQeQEuxUf8GHhtsKft7gQ.text: The customer service provided by the runner Freddy was just FANTASTIC!  He went above and beyond, and he was even the server! We came during lunch, expecting a long wait but we were seated super quick. I looked over the menu and Freddy brought out chips, beans, and salsa. I added salt to the beans and skimmed the menu. I checked out the lunch menu, because how can you pass up an entree and a drink for a set price?!  Out came the fideo and I ordered a deconstructed chimichanga with carne asada. Now, this was my first chimichanga and boy was it delicious! The exterior was crispy and delicious and the inside was busting the seams with carne asada. On the side was my beans and rice and some guac with lettuce. Freddy recommended I get some enchilada sauce to put on top or dip. BOMB.  The chips and salsa were also yummy, and the ambiance is so fun and nice!   Go with their lunch menu deals, you will not be sorry!

OJnOuTZi7RXePuFLiZkM8w.text: We have been here many times. Today we ordered the guacamole, the carnitas house special, the chicken Tia Esther and the Flan. It was all fantastic.  Our server, Miguel was also amazing. My wife liked the Tia Esther so much she wanted to order it again immediately.  We really look forward to coming back. Definitely worthy of five stars.

3g3q4kgdx8I2rG6STt2ZCg.text: I don't have words to express how much I loved this place! The best margaritas I've tasted, the food was amazingly delicious and fresh, the service was top-notch and the vibe was great.  I will definitely come back to Vegas just to visit this place again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flan
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Ice Cream
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carnitas

vtVZfJw4qxnwEZZ492WrQA.text: My boyfriend and I were looking for a great Mexican restaurant so I searched the internet and read reviews and this place was on almost every list of great authentic Mexican restaurants. I got the steak and lobster and he got the carne asada nachos.  My meal was $39.95 and worth every penny. We had to wait quiet a while for our food but to me it was well worth it. My lobster and steak were absolutely perfect. The  steak was huge and I had some left to take home (for a nice breakfast of steak and eggs tomorrow). It was cooked exactly as I ordered it, rare. The texture of the lobster was spot on and it was delicious in the garlic sauce. I also had a peach margarita that was great.  My boyfriend was not as pleased with his nachos. The steak on the nachos was way overdone and rubbery.  The staff were friendly and seemed to work well as a team.  Just be aware, unlike a lot of places where the chips and salsa are all complimentary, here only the first serving is complimentary. After that you have to pay.  I had a wonderful experience and would definitely come back. My boyfriend would probably be willing to come back but he would definitely order something other than the carne asada nachos.

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lobster and steak. According to the menu it&#39;s recommended by Javier. I also recommend it.

YAldDklFrezpRnzPD_tJ9w.text: Food was delicious but the customer service is what put this experience over the top. Have been to restaurants all over Las Vegas from high end to hole in the walls but nothing has compared to Antonio's service(buser). He is the reason we will be coming back. Kudos to Antonio!

ZDUMi99uVOFLOIB3jBQTAw.text: First time visit. First item on the lunch menu was the pork green chili burrito. It was outstanding!  Pork was lean but still tender and flavorful. Chips and salsa was great...Always a nice bonus. Service was also great...highly recommend.

DWdGwRQCL9wkGNarBaTL9w.text: The atmosphere is nice. There are other Lindo Michoacan locations that I feel are better.   I ordered the cheese enchiladas here and they were actually a bit greasy. I didn't care for that. My cousin ordered the setup that comes with fajitas (just the pico salad, sour cream, guacamole and tortillas) and that really confused the waiter and it came out wrong. She also ordered just rice and beans which was correct.   The margaritas here are a little weak and small for the price.   I would recommend trying the other locations.

SJE8_XawD4DUt9oCbS7lWg.text: In a nutshell: Authentic, tasty, festive  Lindo Michoacan is my number one go-to spot for sit-down leisurely Mexican food dinner. The ambiance is lively and festive, the wait staff are very attentive, and most importantly the food is ALWAYS GREAT! When I have guests in town, and they want Mexican food, I come here, bingo, every time. The atmosphere is so lively and often times loud, which I suppose if you're out for a quiet date night, you make the call. I personally love the lively atmosphere. I've tried something new-to-me each time I've came, and was satisfied each time. Most recently I had the Enchiladas de Suiza, which was pretty darn tasty. I really liked the sauce, which was a family recipe. I always order sopapillas for dessert, and they are served up as a plate of 4 delightful little pillows of yum. There's a reason this place is consistently on the "best of Las Vegas" list, it is well worth visiting for a delightful authentic and festive Mexican dinner! Highly recommend and definitely come back

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Do you even like food?

Lrm6J3bTbJjG3F_HBzax6g.text: Came here on Christmas Eve for dinner. The place wasn't overly crowded and we where seated in the back as soon as we got there. The Service was a little slow but it was worth the wait because the food is great and they give you chop & salsa, also refried beans to hold you over till your food comes out . We ordered the carnitas and steak plates, the carnitas where some of the best I've ever had crispy just right and not overly dry and not to moist and the flavor was really good, I still got those carnitas on my mind, the steak was good to but the carnitas are on point you got to try those carnitas here. I plate run about $19.00  but it worth it. The inside and outside of this place is Decorated real nice make sure you take a look around at all the Mexican art work.

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best carnitas ever

7uA_hmi4qxqgOBce8RxxpQ.text: I loved this place soo much!! From the complimentary cup of fideo to the special birthday sombrero and fake celebratory tequila shot.   We are in town for a birthday and craving some serious Mexican food, but wanted to try something a bit more off the beaten path and less touristy.   Thanks to yelp, we have found another family favorite. The menu is enormous and some of the items I've never even heard of, but you can't go wrong with their famous carnitas.   Service was attentive and the vibe was just super nice. There was someone making fresh tortillas and they were to die for. Some live music started up later in the evening when we were about to leave. We enjoyed our visit so so much. Huge fan and we will most definitely be back.

kieH3A4CMrG41es5SSW1yg.text: Dont think this Mexican restaurant needs any more reviews. Let's just say when we want good traditional Mexican food in Vegas this is where we go! I think I've tried everything on the menu and nothing ever disappointed.  Great food, and great service every time! I've tried other places around the city none besides maybe Viva Mercado compare to this place and great thing about it there lots of other locations and give same experience and quality. I buy gift certificates during the holidays too since there is hardly anyone I know that doesnt love eating here.

O6k29QtX6VBQD4EvJBLB3A.text: My girlfriends and I love coming here for dinner when we find time to get together. The food is always fantastic. My favorites are the table side guacamole, ensalada marinara, and fajitas. But never all three on the same night as the servings are HUGE. The chips, salsa, and beans are fantastic as well. Lindo has been the place we go to laugh and cry and gossip. We love it here!   Do yourself a favor and spend at least one birthday celebration here! You won't regret it.

u8XZwxCYvD_liDHeM_z8lg.text: Lively - the best way to describe the atmosphere on our visit. The place was packed & had people waiting outside. We had a party of 6 but didn't have to wait longer than 10 min. The decor is very colorful, they had a mariachi band making rounds in the restaurant and waiters busily making table side guacamole.   Spreading of table side guacamole, order it! And the ceviche - it was fantastic. They also bring chips & salsa for the table along with a side of retried beans. At this point, I'm usually full, but we pressed forward. I ordered the chile verde. It had great flavor.   Against better judgement, we ordered dessert. Two. The fried ice cream was fantastic! It was quickly devoured. The sopapillas were not what we'd find in New Mexico (light fluffy pillows of fried bread) but they were tasty nonetheless.

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sopapillas
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried ice cream
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dE5-MdV3Ybh3z6pYO2QjPQ.text: I come here at lunch and have an organic margarita and a chicken taco and I play black jack at the bar and sometimes Carmen is there   This is one of my favorite hometown restaurants  Caveman keno!  Casamigos tequila A la carte chicken tacos Hits the spot!

u3OPkV9d_HZanf9XZSFd3w.text: Aye dios mio! This place was AMAZING. We were visiting Vegas from Tucson, AZ. Our friend recommended (actually persistantly insisted that we must go here multiple times throughout the day). My first thought was, why we choosing this place over a vegas buffet we got good Mexican back home. Y desculpe because damnit that was wrong of me to say! Now I will never not come here when I visit! Todo la comida esta tan riquisimo. In other words you want authentic Mexican food that your Nana makes and after a night of drinking and takes care of you like your sick and not just tan crudo/a (hungover af). COME HERE! The whole experience just brought me back to life. First off, as you are seated you get fresh chip and salsa and also frijoles! Next we place our orders from a FULL list of great items to choose from. There menu made it difficult to decide but I went with the Chile Relleno and cheese Enchilada with Rice and Beans everyone else got something different so we (...ok pues I mean "I") can taste a little bit of everything. Once everyone had ordered the waiter came out with a little cup of fideo soup. My eyes lit up like no other. My friend decided to order some guacamole for the table. They prepared it fresh at our table. It was DAMN GOOD! Anyways our food came out so fast and we had a large party of 10. I feel like that is unheard of sometimes with restaurants. And oh my God..these plates had un chingon de comida beautifully laid out on each plate. Are you hooked on this place yet or should I keep going haha! You must try it out yourself. If you have a large party (like we did) be sure to call in advanced to be seated there is a wait but these people know what their doing and get you seated in a timely manner. The staff and incredible friendly and ready to serve you. So show your servers some love because they're about to treat you like family. See you soon - I will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Made and served at your table fresh!!
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Made to order guacamole
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UkR-pjVbZO7Lb9nTnk6oiA.text: Was recommended to go here by a local and was glad they did! They make their own flour and corn tortillas, have a large variety of selections, even Lengua! (Although my friend said it was a bit chewy). They bring you little soap de fideo, and it's quite tasty! Not too overly salted. It's worth going out of your way to go here. The staff is very attentive and kind.

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gorgeous views
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy beans, chips and salsa to start

_olG5_nV8DNzjtQxqediYg.text: If you are looking for great Mexican food and atmosphere, this is a great spot!  There is a great menu with a number of authentic dishes and ample portions. What made the experience exceptional for my family, however, was the service.   From the greeting at the door, to the waiter, to the support staff refilling water, etc. (Jose in particular), we felt like we'd been invited to someone's home and they just wanted us to have a great time. I'm telling you, it was like the Chick-fil-a of Mexican restaurants!  I had the carnitas and thoroughly enjoyed them. Don't sleep on the avacado salsa...it was outstanding!  I'm a pretty good size guy and can eat, and I couldn't take the whole thing down.   Bottom line:  Great food, service and family atmosphere. I highly recommend you give them a try!

KKhvki-cWFfLM82GiQGN0g.text: I got a carne asada plate, the meat was so hard the knife wouldn't even go through. Tried everyone's plate and none of it was seasoned! Paid 80 for 3 people and left sick to my stomach and throwing up! Most def not going back

k133c7UGjsdAsAn1i8kWfg.text: Have not been here in like forever. Hubby and I decided to go Saturday night and boy did we have a blast of a good time. The food was incredibly delicious. I had carnitas fajitas and he had a combo plate with a taco, tamale and enchilada....BOMB BOMB BOMB!!!! I usually get a Cadillac margarita but tonight I had a blueberry margarita and it was made with fresh blueberries. I can hardly wait to go back for more delicious Mexican cuisine and cultural fun!

XUZPGgV51L0ooEcDlYUNlQ.text: Ok here we go yelpers ... the service is outstanding, as others have stated.  So service gets 5 stars.     However, I was not a fan of the shrimp tacos.  They were dry and lacking in flavor.  I wanted to like it here, I really did.  Especially after reading the Yelp reviews.   Not to mention the price ... it was $30 for three tacos a drink and a flan to go.   I'm sorry but I'll take my money elsewhere.  Old school place, with basically mex/American food.

rb8Txm6fMj3Ra1lsiank3Q.text: Best service! Always a must try stop here whenever I'm Vegas! Although, always busy, serve is always exceptional. Jose "chino", Daniel, and the manager were so busy but still very attentive to serving all our needs. A party of 6 and they were keen on recognizing what we might need before we even made requests. I was indecisive as to what to eat, but Daniel recommended "el platillo de plata", if my memory serves me right, but it was amazingly delicious this plate could honestly feed two people. It was a beef, chicken, and shrimp plate that was to die for. I must also mention the live music that was playing during our stay that was icing on the cake because they played great hits. From beginning to end it was a delightful experience. Thank you Lindo Michoacan!

4OTQzKeZuM-nHJUm4V6Cxg.text: If you ever find yourself in Vegas, do me a favor and leave the strip to visit this place. If there was ever any doubt that True hole-in-a-wall restaurants exist in Vegas, this place lays it to rest. Food is delicious. The goatmeat-beer-stew is a must try.

_aAE_1hfDpBIpB9cF3uxNg.text: I like this spot. I liked the staff, atmosphere and food.  We were in a big hurry and explained this to the waiter, and they brought our food out super quick!  They staff was extremely attentive and friendly.   We ordered the guacamole, which they make fresh right at your table.  It was very good.  Then I orders the steak fajitas.  They were decent, but I've had better. They did however put grilled tomatoes in with the meat, peppers and onions, which I liked. They also have amazing fresh flour tortillas that really helped bring up the flavor in the fajita.   If only I wasn't driving, I would have been able to rate the margaritas for you too.   Overall, I really did like the place. I would definitely come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Staff so friendly they joined in the picture. LOL!
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak fajitas
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very attentive staff and quick service!

7NeRbL11fzQiKRET5Ok5jQ.text: My husband and I like this place. I haven't had any issues with the food except that I'm extremely full every time I leave this place. Saw some reviews about the food being bland... that's not an issue as far as I have seen. I would rather have food not salted enough than over salted, honestly. I recommend even just for a social environment and some drinks with friends. Once again this is a restaurant not your madre's cocina.

Q99KcJ7NkN5fLrsmZqmcFQ.text: My sister wedding reception was here. What a great place and I enjoyed it. Table side gacu was good. The salsa was okay. Thank you

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1Z9hvJnD7HZxPYPgDg_Psg.text: This place had the most horrible service , messed up three of our orders, took literally 55 min to bring out a plate. One of plates apparently was not submitted and three different waiters had to ask what the plate was. The most simplest little things made our experience horrible. Sad for a place that has high ratings.

TR8EoeI_PNnvQNSfhoHO2g.text: Being Mexican, my family and I always desire "homemade" Mexican food, specifically a place with fresh authentic beans. Coming from southern California we have pretty high standards when it comes to Mexican food. Lindo Michoacan did not disappoint! Some of the best Mexican, if not the best Mexican food I have tried in Las Vegas! I made reservation for Saturday night at 7 pm. And when my family and I arrived the place was packed! As we waited for our table there was a live mariachi band for entertainment. We did not have to wait long to be seated, where our drink order was taken and chips salsa and, bean dip were placed on the table as an appetizer. Yum! Salsa was delicious and had a bit of heat and great chili flavor. The bean dip was my favorite, like I said you know a Mexican place is good if they make good beans! The chips were delicious as well and obviously homemade. Service was friendly and prompt, even in the midst of a rush hour. I ordered a bean and cheese burrito wet, it was a generous portion and was very delicious. The wet sauce was tomato based which was delicious, however next time I will request the diablo sauce, which is more of an enchilada type sauce. My whole family enjoyed their dinner plates and all of the food looked delicious to me. I can't wait to try more on the menu!

hwFpPMMoQjG02y3q3qyfuw.text: Went here for dinner on friends recommendation and it did not disappoint.  We typically stay on the strip so this was quite a venture out for us.  I believe that there is a closer one to the strip...but we had to check out the "original" one. We came on a friday night at 6:30pm and found it starting to fill up. Location/Ambience:  About 15mins from the strip.  Easy to find and plenty of parking in the back.  The vibe was chill.  Decorated in traditional mexican decor.  Restrooms were clean.  They would arrange tables to fit group size. Service:  This was the best service at a Mexican restaurant that I have ever received.  we were greeted and shown to a table right away.  As soon as we sat down, chips/salsa/beans (yes beans) were placed in front of us.  Multiple people would stop by and ask if everything was ok.  Great recommendations.  Loved the fact that there was a lady making fresh tortillas in the corner.  Food came out at a decent pace.  Drinks came out super fast.   Food:  The menu was definitely extensive.  Nicely organized by proteins.  LOts of things I wanted to try.  I loved the chips/salsa/beans.  NOt terribly spicy but got a nice heat to the salsa.  I opted fro the Buey Al Cilantro (on server recommendation).  I have never ordered a steak (rib eye) from a mexican restaurant, but this turned out to be fantastic.  IT was cooked perfectly medium.  But what made it awesome was the cilantro/onion/chile verde sauce.  It was really really good.  I would cut a strip, add some beans/rice, and eat it with their tortilla.  I'm still thinking about that dish.  Great value at $20 too.  My wife got a seafood soup and that had some nice flavor as well.  The mango margarita was a tad too sweet.  But the original one was great.   I would definitely recommend this place.  I would love to return and try out the other items.

wi-egVd_EMCjfGXMW7DrCg.text: One of the best places in Vegas! I'm so happy that we came here!  We ordered the guacamole, and it was made table side. It was amazing. Super fresh and flavor-filled. I appreciate how we could request the spicy level.   Not knowing many authentic Mexican dishes, I ordered chicken fajita. I was kind of bummed because I generally don't like fajitas, but I was wrong! This fajita was the best I ever had, and I'm so glad I got it! The chicken was so good that I could eat it by itself. The meal came with rice, refried beans, sour cream and guacamole. The tortillas are also made fresh. All perfect with my meal. Big enough to feed two small ladies like myself; in retrospect, I should have shared it.  I forgot what the dessert we ordered was called, but it was basically vanilla ice cream covered in crunchy flakes, caramel, and cinnamon. It was covered in rum and then lit on fire in ordered for it to caramelize. Very strong rum flavor, so don't get it if you don't like alcohol.   If I ever come back to Vegas, I definitely will come back here. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MUqkpWniU_mogGAL5YJJow.text: Have been here several times. Sometimes it's off the hook and other times is so very disappointing  if you come in after 8 pm food is totally inconsistent-- carne asada tacos came out as if meat was boiled grey looking horrible. The time before early evening it was amazing dark, caramelized the way it should be. Another time rice was so hard and crusted!! They should be ashamed to serve that--if too late to make more then offer fries something else instead of serving a staple --Mexican  rice that old and dry. I just don't understand why so inconsistent??? For as many years as they've been voted  "The Best" it makes no sense. Also if you dine late night expect to eat in silence  after 10 not even overhead music, even if customers are still arriving as they advertise open till midnight.

taClqYdouEgweZW49FPmrw.text: Festive atmosphere as soon as you walk in. Family oriented. Great food and service. As soon as I sat down we were asked for our drink order. The chips and bean/salsa dip was good. I had so much food I could not eat it all and took the rest home for supper. If you are a veteran or military you get 50% off!!!!

CkDnosFcSnbi1mX6V8VVvg.text: I have ate at Lindo Michoacan several times at both locations . They are both great I do prefer the desert inn location. The food is always delicious and the service matches . We have two young kids and they definitely cater to them they bring them soup within a few minutes of seating us . I have order a wide variety of things there and have never left disappointed .

n3FjG9ruSzVftoP3b5nGNA.text: Food and service are impeccable here....Best Mexican restaurant in Vegas! They never disappoint. Every time I have eaten here it reminds me of my abuelas cooking.

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #20 combination with a Chile Relleno, green chicken enchilada and tamale....delicious!
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flautas and wet pollo asado burrito
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fountain outside of restaurant

EUOkk30syBOFPn8wfetCwg.text: Amazing service and staff. The food was delicious and the environment was great. Definitely coming back when we visit again.

B56SfnCbCvVUeAKZrKz12Q.text: Love this place!! Come every single time I'm in Vegas, food is good, prices are good, service is always great. One of my favorite mexican restaurants.

wtrRVlPmdVbRiR81olHjTA.text: Will defiantly return again! First time here and the service was amazing! Drinks and food was great and especially our servers! Thank you for a great first experience and for celebrating my brothers graduation with us.

1laAi8P9k1X8wKl4F9eZMw.text: My favorite Mexican Restaurant in Las Vegas. Great service good food and wonderful atmosphere.

Vuz6K7zqS2RScphAu35epQ.text: I've been here twice now. Both times were exceptional. The service was amazing. We never had to worry about our water or drinks running out.   The home made tortillas were great. I had the "Fajitas de Camarones" (shrimp fajitas). They were good, not great but definitely worth what we paid. My girlfriend ordered what I believe they call the "Steak Ranchero" and it was huge cooked perfect.   They also have a mariachi band which was fun. Definitely a family friendly restaurant. Their customer service is through the roof with decently priced meals.

EqAw0sCguvoQ9uLEHRsPzw.text: Great food great service ! Highly recommended ! Everyone was very friendly and attentive. Food came in at a timely manner and well portioned. $45 for an appetizer and two meals. Not bad at all.

Vtz8siDg1V8M2aqlQtKQQQ.text: I love off the strip restaurants so if you have a hankering for Mexican food, stop by. We got there after 7p on a Friday and the mariachi was playing. Also, if you like camarones al la diabla, ask to make them extra spicy.  Great service and attentive management. Will return.

N5qvuIBbKZN2XIqM--LB1A.text: I am always looking for a good place to take relatives from out of town. Somewhere that is only in Vegas and not a chain. My Cousin was visiting from out of town and we went here on a Friday for lunch. The parking lot was very full so I was worried there would be a long wait. We were greeted at the door and immediately seated. We were given chips, salsa and bean dip right away. They were nice and fresh. Our drink orders were taken and delivered and our food came out really fast! I had the lunch enchilada special. It was very tasty. The service and food were excellent! I will definitely come back!

3e41Ae8UBBZbfduvFS7ckA.text: Delicious food - i ordered the cheese enchiladas verdes. Yumm!! We had a party of 30 - staff was friendly and attentive. The mariachi group was really good!

OnSZAKGbO07aIaoaTvYIBA.text: Been here a few times. Service is excellent! Consistent quality and quantity. Best mexican food experience next to home cooked. Reccomend the carnitas coca-cola, tableside guacamole app, and cadilac margaritas!

iKNBoXb108jhEnr5HTnddA.text: I love this place every time I come from LA I always take my family to eat!!! Every time is gets better and the service is amazing!!! I'll keep coming here every time I come to Vegas

vOPYExpz4aJ53o6mhbuNWw.text: I have been coming here for years. Great food, great prices and the staff is always so nice.  Even when I order something as simple as the tacos I'm always pleased.   Their guacamole has this unique kick to it that I just love.   I love when the mariachi band cruses the dining room. I never find it annoying. :) It makes for a festive experiance!

SIdkuPwqT21jHCx35ssRng.text: We were in Vegas for my friends Bachelor party last weekend and we went here for Mexican food based on reviews here ...let me tell you guys something I have traveled the world and been in many nice restaurants in my life , as far as service I have never been to a better place than this one .The service was more than amazing .The food was fresh and delicious and on par with the top Mexican food I have had .The inside decor is great and easy on the eyes .If I could give them 10 stars I would . Great place

FaiUuIjXVfFcwDw00npBMw.text: Best Mexican food in Vegas!! The soup that they start you off with is so tasty I loved it! We also tried the freshly made guacamole with chips and WOW! I had to have the  camarones borrachos (drunk shrimp) and they were great!! We are definitely coming back for more.

M1gr6LMK7MgQvC_RZ7KbBw.text: I came here with a friend who was in town visiting. We wanted good Mexican food after we read a few reviews we opted for this place. Upon arrival the place looked packed and walking up we were almost sure we'd have at least a 45min wait, if not longer. Maybe we were lucky but as soon as we came in we had a table available to us and we didn't feel crammed with all the people around. It was comfortable, our servers were really nice and the food was quick! And not in a bad way. We ordered a beer and a margarita and they were both good. Our server brought out a frozen glass for the beer too..even better! We both agreed we'd come back and that it was a cool place.

mCms6Wrzd75Gyox57zZwXA.text: One of The best restaurant in Vegas! Great Mexican food excellent services!Love this place! I will go again! Yummy!!

EO6fz0rzdyZZQOlbNShLNw.text: Tourists!! There are gems to be found outside of the glittery Strip... and some of these gems have shuttles! Hence, Lindo Michoacan, five stars for you. First of all, quick service with a smile always goes a long way with me. Secondly, chips and salsa AND bean dip to start off... win. Thirdly, tableside guacamole spiced to your preference? Getouttahere. Fourthly, a menu with something delicioso for EVERYONE, including us vegheads. Fifthly (not even a word), the fact that they had a full house and could still capably handle the group of 18 that we were in... seriously en pointe service. Drinks refilled in minutes, orders placed in front of you instead of called out (one of my huge pet peeves) and never felt pressured to get out once the check was presented. Take advantage of the shuttle situation and GO!!

JNM31x6rTJ5TyX9TE7HKfg.text: Great food. Salsa was fantastic. Our server Pedro was super friendly and fast. The fideo soup is killer! We had two little kids with us, and no-one treated us differently. Thus is our new go-to for any trip to Vegas. The carnitas are to die for!!! Worth the drive a little off the beaten path. Don't miss this place, if you are a fan of authentic and delicious mexican cuisine.

WIbBfTfgJbHeQGIZ53lJVg.text: I was in Vegas last Friday 8/7,  my girlfreind and I hopped in a cab and asked the driver if he knew any good Mexican resturaunts in the area.. after a $25.00 cab ride we were greeted by a young hostes who was very freindly.  We ordered the red chille plate. the chips came to our table, they were warm and stale! then the food, we both took 1 bite of the steak picado and could not eat anymore! I am not a complainer but when the waiter ask me how it was I told him, "it is discusting" he asked why I explained it was very chewy. his reply was "you want some ceviche or something" I said please just give me the bill. after spending $100.00 to get there take 1 bite and get back to my hotel I just had to say something. I would leave only 1 star, the second star is for the nice hostes only. I have never in my life had worse!

w4cBRzgEg-3SJzVoz6dVRg.text: One of the best Mexican food experiences I've had in the US.  Chips, salsa, beans - BOMB.  Sopa de fideos - BOMB.  And the menu options are ridiculous.  The ultimate in tasty food.  LOVE Lindo Michoacan!!

s_u_nxvtLLyHXH8jbaxl4w.text: Food was awesome the service was horrible.  Literally took over 30 mins after we were done eating to get a to go box and our check!  Disappointing :(

92qro8Tn-WeYnWbUC8rsmg.text: Hands down the best mexican I've had in town...so far.  Very authentic and they have a huge menu that should suit every taste.  In the middle room you can even see the tortillas being freshly made.  The only thing that was bad about my second trip was the fact that for the life of me I couldn't remember what I got the first time to order it again...but my second meal was excellent as well.  The guac is made table side and is super fresh.  I love making homemade guac myself and actually will not make it without cilantro anymore because they used it at Lindo and it really made a difference.  We live a good 6 miles or so away and on the way everyone was asking why we were traveling so far for this restaurant and if we were getting Mexican food, why we couldn't go to one of the one hundred places that are closer.  By the end of the meal everyone need why and gave me kudos for the selection.  It will be hard to go anywhere else when I have a craving for Mexican food.

29uufjy9pi3U-OWWMQ8Y1w.text: Best Mexican food in. Vegas bar none. They authentic and the table side guacamole is excellent. They have a few dishes in this restaurant that I have only seen in Mexico. I would recommend either of their mole selections because both are excellent, but my absolute favorite is the Tia Esther chicken plate. It's a little spicy but it's amazing. Be careful not to fill up on chips

nUzTdFSdpE65TJJdCTlj-g.text: I've been going here for years, and have has almost everything on the menu. Hands down my favorite Mexican place in town! I can't say just one thing is the best, I'd say get a combo plate, and go wild. The margaritas are great, and they have the best tequila selection as well. 21+ can sit at the bar surrounded by all the beautiful bottles and enjoy the live entertainment. I've never had a bad experience here in the 6+ years I've been going.

R1iGILgKno-EUfzNU92l9Q.text: Holy cow! We were looking for a good Mexican restaurant in the Las Vegas area, and after researching Yelp, found this place. It was AMAZING! Very impressed. It's clean, fresh, tasty and has fantastic service. Recommend A+++!

nPxESEDMu9UY-4-cRFcEDg.text: Probably the best Mexican Restaurant we have found in Las Vegas .  Fairly small and off the beaten path.  More for locals than visitors.  Service is expedient and excellent.  Great choice in menu, takes a while to read the entire menu.  All the typical Mexican dishes plus a lot of house specialties.  Probably ranks as medium priced.  Food was positively excellent, just too much to eat.

opdRHAA3DLniG_SbBZ61Jw.text: The service is always quick, the staff is amazing and the food is by far the best in Vegas. Wish they would move a location to SoCal.

OP99HO6rjUkWIRnfku0q4w.text: So after making the choice of tying the knot in Vegas during Labor Day weekend 2016, we needed a place to have the dinner afterwards. First choice was a Buffet, but after calling so many locations and all of them saying it would have to be paid in advance and then no refund if someone did not show up there was no refund. Tried calling some restaurants serving american food, and they wanted a deposit and give a special menu, I was stressing out trying to find a location that would accommodate about 20 people. The thing about my party is that most of them are Japanese since my now wife is Japanese, so trying to accommodate every one with food choices. But come remember that they all love Mexican food. So I found this place on yelp and called to see what they could do for me. To my surprise, no special menu, no deposit and every one got there on check. But the best part was when we show up and they ask for me and my wife to go in last. They sat all our guest, and then let us in. As we came in they had the mariachi playing for us! Best entrance ever. I have to give it to this place the atmosphere was great and the food was AWESOME! The waiters were very attentive to all our needs, they were awesome! Everyone in my party was satisfied with their food. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone stopping by Vegas. Sorry to Original Lindo Michoacan for the late review.

Xd3qCkkJxJq6P_0MjiGGRg.text: It was a very nice experience. Yes it was noisy and it a little crowded but very nice. The food was great! It is so far one of the best real Mexican restaurants I been to. Coming from a Mexican. :) The staff was very polite with my husband and I. They are very busy but when they came to talk to me they took their time they weren't rushing me they made feel important. Somebody was always checking on us to make sure we had drinks and to make sure we were satisfied and we were very satisfied! A little pricey yes, but very worth it!

STfrxy-18sfIVo7O0OVkmg.text: What a beautiful restaurant. The colorful tile, the fountain, the artwork, the stained glass window... Very authentic. Guacamole made fresh and to order at the table. The homemade tortillas were hot and delicious. We had attentive service for our group of 10 during lunch rush- they even let us order on separate checks. Food was served quickly and to order. Drinks were refilled often.The employees seemed to really enjoy working there. I saw a place for a live band and a very well stocked bar.. I will be back to enjoy that!

HHzgIxKChtIa2Zg220DoMg.text: Overall one of the best Mexican places I've had in Vegas.  Since re-locating here I've had some problems finding a good value when it comes to meals.  Lindo has become a "go to" place for me and many of my friends because of the portion size and affordable price.  I normally get a simple combo plate for around $15.  This place does not try to be fancy and flashy which is another reason I'm attracted to it.

KEa_FVeGh5HCsemlJsUBEg.text: We loved the design and decor of this Mexican restaurant and we had high hopes based on the reviews and buzz. We arrived at 4:50pm on a Friday which turned out to be 10 minutes before happy hour ended. The restaurant was already getting busy, and our server scrambled to make sure we got our drinks at the happy hour half-price which we appreciated very much - $5.00 for Javier's Margarita and $2.75 for an ice-cold pint of draft Pacifico. These happy hour drink prices alone make OLM one of the best values in Las Vegas, and as we perused the fantastic menu with many dishes we had never seen or heard of before it looked like we were heading into an easy 5-star experience. The food, unfortunately, changed all that.  When we were seated we were served fresh tortilla chips, warm bean dip, and pinkish salsa that had a bit of a bite. I thought all were great but my GF thought the salsa tasted odd and "off" somehow.   For the past several days we had been doing a Queso Fundido with chorizo tour around Las Vegas, trying this dish at a variety of area Mexican restaurants, and we were looking forward to trying OLM's version. OLM charges $8.50 for plain Queso Fundido and you can add chorizo for $1.00 more. We ordered this and when it arrived we could see no chorizo in the dish. We poked around in it and it turned out they had put a tiny amount (perhaps a bit less than a teaspoon) of chorizo underneath the top layer of cheese. The tiny crumbles of chorizo we were able to locate were barely enough to taste, but when we did get a taste it was very good. To the management of Original Lindo Michoacan: we would gladly have paid an extra $2.50 for a decent amount of chorizo in your Queso Fundido. This is typically what your competitors charge for a more generous amount, and by charging only $1.00 for this and then appearing to skimp on it and not really deliver it to your customers you are shooting yourselves in the foot.  After drinks, chips, and queso we were getting full and we really had no room left for a huge plate of food. So we ordered a single, a la carte Al Pastor taco in order to see how well OLM does with Al Pastor which is another one of our Mexican favorites. We have had some absolutely spectacular Al Pastor in Las Vegas at many restaurants and taco shops, and again we were looking forward to tasting OLM's version.  The taco arrived and it was pathetic. It was really just little nuggets of gristly pork fat with virtually no Al Pastor flavor or color at all. Ugh. We were left wondering how a restaurant with the reputation and following that OLM has could fail so badly with this Mexican staple. Oh well.   Original Lindo Michoacan gets 3.5 stars for our first visit. They had everything in place for an easy 5 stars but the kitchen made sure that didn't happen. We are willing to return once more during happy hour to give their kitchen another chance by trying some other items on their really interesting menu, and to again enjoy some of their well-priced drinks. However, we now realize that Original Lindo Michoacan may emerge as the best choice for happy hour drinks only, and at 5:00pm we'll need to move on to another place for some Mexican food.

cjOi2LQDQ59tBN7O7m10Wg.text: About 30 of us came in from out of town to celebrate my mom's 60th birthday.  I did a little research trying to find an amazing Mexican Restaurant and hit the bulls-eye!    AWESOME customer service!    Every time I called the restaurant to coordinate or ask questions about our upcoming dinner, they were super friendly and appeasing!  They had no problem letting me bring in a cake and actually let me drop it off the evening before to keep in their refrigerator (sneaking in the back door so I didn't have to get caught up in the huge line upfront)!   It was just a wonderful experience - the staff was fun, polite and very attentive!    The food was great -  I wasn't the biggest fan of what I had ordered (Gallo al Mojo de Ajo - just wasn't my cup of tea) but ended up nibbling off of my mom's burrito (and taking the rest back to my hotel) and it was AMAZING!    The best part of the night was when they came out to sing Happy Birthday to my mom, aunt and great uncle (who turned 80!).  They must have had pretty much the whole staff come out to sing with surprise tequila shots!  I had read some of the reviews before and so I knew it was going to happen, but totally blanked until moments before!  I just wished I had grabbed my phone to record it because it was HILARIOUS!!!    Thank you for such a wonderful time and thank you for the awesome customer service!!!

wt2YFBT-rj2pCv_ZxsAplw.text: I came in here around 10:00 am on Saturday. The place was packed! However, we were seated right away. I was extremely impressed with the authentic and unique decor of this place. It was beautiful. Very original Mexican style. Not likes some of the fake cheesy Mexican joints. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Live mariachi playing. They have a hand-made tortilla stand with ladies constantly making fresh tortillas. If you order guacamole, it gets hand made to order right at your table. Also, when you are seated, they bring fresh refried bean dip, salsa, chips and Mexican noodle soup (sopa de fideo). Very nice touch by the way! I'm from Los Angeles, and I've never been to a restaurant like this before. I will definitely be coming back here next time I visit my family in Las Vegas. :)

CrelZIbO8BOr_Mb5XNdxUg.text: Greatest Mexican food we've had in two and a half years. (We came to Vegas from the Dallas Texas area.)The service is outstanding and the menu has a tremendous selection of dishes to choose from. If your looking for a great Mexican meal with a very relaxing environment put this place on your list.

ROVlBPldvDc_p3Nzr-qNsw.text: From beginning to end I love this place and I make sure to eat here every single time I'm in Vegas. Delicious and you can never go wrong! I take new ppl with me every time and they alll love it!

g0lGDSoEPj139C4_LK2CRA.text: I love this place!  Every time I go to Vegas, I come here.  It's off the strip but great prices and food.  I highly recommend the drive!  Nothing at this place is bad.

as6KsKMVRcyn1crs6iAK-A.text: All I can say is wow.    Prices aren't the cheapest, but I guarantee this will be some of the best Mexican food you've had in a while.   I had the Pollo Asado burrito, which was awesome!   Our waiter (can't remember his name!!!) was awesome!   He had a great sense of humor with us drunk folk and gave us flawless service.

HMo7XcC7Z86dolmWHitPWg.text: Food was good but the server took about 20 minutes to bring us drink plus another 20 minutes on giving us the food. Server didn't take the time to asks us if we needed anything else after the food was served. Very upset. I believe is under new management. People slower than before. After 5 years of coming to this restaurant I will go to another chain of their own. Never coming back.

8rnZDX8gLW-HYgrYFMTsPQ.text: I love the decor, and all the hostess's are dressed up in really pretty Mexican skirts and blouses. I can't quite name a favorite dish, but so far every thing ive tried here is awesome. So if you have never been here or your visiting Las Vegas PLEASE try this place!!! You won't regret it!

7D8R9Bg_xTsd-_6BIhBDJA.text: It actually breaks my heart to write this review. Any other time I have been here I've always received excellent service and the food has been awesome....until yesterday... My boyfriend both worked  half days yesterday so we decided to meet at Lindo for lunch. We sat at the bar because it was lunchtime so obviously we knew it was going to be packed. The bartender was really nice and served us right away...then it all went downhill. My boyfriend order the chicken crema y rajas, i ordered shrimp mojo de ajo. When the food came out, mine was chicken instead of shrimp so I sent it back and the bartender apologized. It was fine I had time to kill anyway. Boy oh boy... As the server put the plate down, all the juice spilled all over my dress!!!!!  It was HOT!! But sh.. Happens!! When I looked at WHAT was on my plate .....it was the poorest excuse of ajo I have ever seen in my life!!!! Very watery, no garlic, it tasted like lemon water with a bit of tomato!!! I know this dish well since I order it all the time. At this point i start getting mad!!! The bartender said she was going to get the manager which we waited and waited and waited and waited but she was too busy getting chips for the five gentlemen that were seated at the bar next to us. Being a manager you might want to take care of the serious problem at the end other end of the bar first just saying.... At this point I am soaked in shrimp, tomato lemon water. My dress is ruined..and Im still hungry. My boyfriends appetite was ruined so he just boxed his up. All I got was an apology and the shrimp removed from the bill. This was THE worst dining experience I ever had. Its sad that it had to happen here. The manager should have done more on her part to rectify the situation. Not everyone in management deserves the title.   And p.s.... I never got my soup either. :(

z9bDBOgWXspuA-8MTzFiXA.text: I usually visit the location, but this lazy, weatherly Friday night I didn't want to go out so I ordered through Postmates. I have to say, everything was absolutely perfect, from my add-ons to my deletions (with a tiny absence of my Ranchero sauce ) Steak cooked perfectly, the chips, salsa and frijoles you get complementary when you come in were all included, plus the extra salsa requested, an abundance of fresh, hot tortilla chips, fideo, guacamole, corn and flour tortillas, etc. My bag must've weighed several pounds! Being a Dallas transplant, good Tex-Mex was a challenge to find here. But this place is definitely a gem!

ThAVYaShcNx4ESApqRv2XQ.text: Our best meal during 3.5 days in Las Vegas!  Atmosphere, service and food were all fantastic when our group of 5 visited last Thursday.    I could tell it was going to be a delicious dinner when the chips and salsa came out.  Also, the bean dip served with the chips was wonderful.  Not sure if this is a local thing, but bean dip is not typically served automatically at our Mexican restaurants.  We also ordered guacamole and the shrimp ceviche, and after the appetizers I was so full I could have skipped dinner.  But I didn't.  I had the carnitas coca cola, which was a nice twist on a pork entree.  The marinade was just slightly sweeter than I prefer, but it was very good.  Entree portions are huge - my boyfriend and I wished we had split because neither of us finished our dinners.  Friends ordered the goat stew, steak with green chiles and another order of the carnitas specialty and everyone loved their meals.  We filled the table with food and drinks, everyone left full and the best part of all was the total for the meal was about half what we spent on other dinners in Las Vegas.  We didn't know about the free shuttle to and from the Strip, so we came in a cab and then used the shuttle to go back to our hotel.  What a great bonus to an already wonderful meal!

LcAGJ7ZX3jX_V2W3qdMNKQ.text: This is our favorite Mexican restaurant to go here in Las Vegas. The food is always fresh hot and excellent. The servers are friendly and they have a kids menu to cater to the kids. Good vibes good Mexican food!

w4jQvqy2hJ6GRaerv--XQQ.text: I am from Southern California where you can get authentic Mexican food pretty much anywhere! Since moving to Vegas, I have had a very hard time finding decent Mexican food.  I read so many positive reviews about this place that I thought I would give them a try.  I don't know what you people consider "authentic" Mexican food, but this isn't it.   The decor was very nice, I really loved the inside of the restaurant.  The staff were all very friendly as well.  The salsa was not good at all.  It wasn't spicy enough and was actually kind of bland.  The fideo soup was new to me, I've never seen that before in a restaurant and it was alright.  I ordered a beef taco, beef enchilada and chile relleno plate.  They used the same green sauce on both the beef enchilada and chile relleno.  The sauce tasted like it was from a can.  And unless everyone else has it wrong, I've never heard of green sauce on a beef item.  I do not recommend this place, nor will I eat here again.  It is kind of sad too because as I said,  the decor and service were excellent.

z-TQQkeGoNEwj_a-Vzf-Ng.text: My favorite place to eat in Vegas. Worth the 10 min taxi off the strip. Order the guacamole and skip a major entree or share. You'll leave stuffed and having had the best time. Live music happens on the regular, the service is spectacular & the food is perfect!

7LUd9Q16TWWy7qEC40SeVg.text: this place has the best guacamole i have ever had in my life, and they make it right at your table. This place was VERY busy when i was here on cindo de mayo but its a True mexican restaurant. The ambience is awesome... there was a mariachi band and a guy singing while playing guitar while we enjoyed our dinner and delicious margarita mangos!! Everyone in my group was happy with their meal :)

wSuUpG0Ta7PNtowL-JDmMg.text: First time here and it was amazing! Our server was Javier and he gave some of the best service I've had since I moved to Vegas...as soon as we were sat he was right there to get our drink order! My husband ordered the Don Francisco and I ordered the enchiladas camarone both dinners were delicious...we will definitely be back!!!

V5l7kt-xErd5lYIyi3TojA.text: Outstanding service and great food!  This is by far the best Mexican place to eat.  Fresh made tortillas made in front of you.   A margarita to die for with plenty booze.  Definitely see Francisco the waiter he is the best

Yg6BQaU1ZkNKYHLdONvbBQ.text: "Do they have 6 stars?" Everything about Lindo Michoacan is awesome, and hands down the best Mexican food ever.  When we visit Vegas you can guarantee we are leaving the Strip because we aren't leaving without at least two visits here. #worththedrive #fideosoup

hnBMW8DISfC9yJqqGHiM8A.text: Craving Authentic Mexican? Lindo might be the place to go to. Lindo is actually a sit down restaurant where you sit, order, and then pay at the end of your visit. We were promptly seated and a few minutes later, complimentary chips and salsa were delivered to the table, what a nice surprise! Me and my friend ate about 12 tacos in total, 6 each with different types of meat.  Food came out pretty quickly and looked delicious. Almost forgot to take a picture for the gram! They tasted pretty bomb. It seemed like every taco was made perfectly: the Asada was perfectly seasoned and charred, the al pastor was juicy and smothered in sauce, and the BBQ beef and beef tongue were equally delicious. Only downside was that they didn't have a salsa bar with jalapenos or extra onions/cilantro, but they seriously pack the meat in those tacos so it wasn't really necessary anyway. They also make their own tortillas so they had the perfect texture.   Service was wonderful as the waitress was super genuine and nice!   Will DEFINITELY be back!

P_L5XrOoOoyhvOxX77A7EA.text: Solid traditional Mexican food. It was recommended by a local resident who's originally from Mexico. The restaurant has won many awards and is well worth the hype. Great service. Super friendly and attentive. Good veggie options!

Vtb4nhF75zzh0n97Xv1UHQ.text: Authentic Mexican food. Best in Vegas in my book. Always busy but they are fast and there's a bar

reM5CNqd_3ua1g2B4c4y2g.text: Wife's boss recommended, hands down best food, taste, service and price. No negatives what so ever. Guacamole made tableside in front of you! Probably going back before we go home...That good!!!

PckslpCXpZnOqYzxTx6k1g.text: Update 30-Oct-18  Wifey and I stopped by yesterday (Sunday) morning for a late breakfast.   What a great idea!   The place wasn't crowded but the chorizo and eggs and the machacha were awesome.   It was a great way to start the day.  Also, the Mexican coffee was perfect, strong and smooth.   Mexican breakfast is really good.

k_85usd80DaLC9jEHw4X3Q.text: No good! Save yourself some time and heartache and go to Chapala's instead. On the other hand, if you'd like to be served really small bowls of salsa and wait forever to get your food, go here!

ZKhWDGyG1gGQ-mJJfCX1zQ.text: The Mexican spot to eat in Vegas.  Can't go wrong with Fajitas. Steaming and Sizzling to order.

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids will get this to entertain themselves
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Fajitas. Steaming and Sizzling to order. Can&#39;t go wrong with this dish.  The Mexican spot to eat in Vegas

hyR_Q7hIId1nHt3OD-9zjA.text: Wonderful Mexican Food  The place was full of people, energy and the wonderful smells from the food just the taste buds twitching and they weren't disappointed. Margaritas to get things underway, Oysters to start and then into the Rib-eye with cilantro sauce, which was an interesting experience and one I would recommend.  We will be back!!

E1AsG9dJcIqvLn3_iLNgiA.text: I'm from LA where there are a ton of great Mexican restaurants. In LV, we have had a hard time finding a great Mexican place, everything is very bland.   This place is incredible! the live music and fun atmosphere are what draw you in but the great food and service are what get you to stay.   The food was incredible and the margaritas were so good. This place will definitely be a go to from now on and we will be bringing everyone we know!

hGtxGXTE4n6_i6W0PLr7KA.text: This is a fabulous place.  There are hard to find any opportunities for improvement here.  The food was excellent, well spiced.  This not not "Tex-Mex" or "Southwestern".  Here you will find homemade taco shells fresh out of the fryer and a nicely textured masa on the tamale.  Meat was sliced or shredded, not minced.  Guacamole made table side to your specifications.  Food is spicy without being overbearing and there is more to the flavor to the profile than jalapeno.  In fact, if I can handle it most people would say it's not "hot" enough for Mexican cuisine but I would suggest this is more authentic than what you find in many "Mexican" restaurants.  The only thing I wasn't over the moon with was the cheese enchilada which was good but a little on the oily side.  Really, it's hard not to get a cheese enchilada without a ton of oil on it anywhere.  Beyond that, the place is very clean and brightly decorated. It was large with plenty of room for large parties, very family friendly. Wait staff are extremely courteous and quick without being intrusive even during peak lunch hour when the place was really hopping.  Glasses never got empty, chip bowl never got empty of homemade tortilla chips.  Food came out quickly and hot.  Lunch for two with appetizer and teas $45 before tip and we left a lot of food behind because we weren't headed back to a place we could keep it cool.  If you are a lighter eater, consider sharing a plate, even at lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Texture on the masa was excellent and the meet was shredded, not minced.
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bHH7FZd-oHqWqOACjEBCJA.text: Took the family here and we were totally floored at how beautiful and festive the surroundings were! Every room is an event!   We got a fabulous booth by the homemade tortilla station and were immediately brought yummy chips, bean dip and (spicy!) salsa. We were also brought cups of soup - a totally unexpected treat that our kids devoured!   Kid review:  We ordered the kids some homemade tortillas (which they did NOT share with us) and the kids menu chicken-which were like thin filets fried, yet like roasted chicken-they LOVED it! Their lemonade apparently were a HUGE hit, as well! This is now our kids number 1 favorite restaurant of all!!! I wished I'd written down all the compliments they kept blurting out throughout their meals!   Adult review:  My husband and I couldn't resist splitting two entrees- enchiladas-one Mole sauce and one Green sauce (starts with an "A") with diced onions on top-yum!!! I must say that I don't usually like rice but the serving size was so cute and small it made the "dish" as a whole, very appealing!   And ...omg...the coconut Margarita (blended!) with fresh grated coconut sprinkled on top.....yuuuuuuuuuuuum!!!!!!   Husband's highlights: Blue Cadillac Margarita tasted crisp and strong and the chip in the entree was like a sinfully delicious chimichanga!

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A FESTIVE experience-we are hooked!
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut (w/ fresh shaved coconut!) and Blue Cadillac Margaritas-LOVE!!!
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids LOVED dipping chips in the soup!

p9orQGcLhB9PGEIzEN8beg.text: The food is outstanding! I've never experienced such great service anywhere like Lindo Michoacan.  I go to Vegas from Phoenix specifically to dine here.

TcF3cce73sBVI02u5FwVCQ.text: This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Vegas. My husband hates margaritas and he loves the mango margaritas!!! We are enjoying ceviche, table side fresh guac, beams, salsa, and we ordered. The portions are huge and I am excited to eat my leftovers. Yum! You won't be disappointed.

Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango margaritas! My husband doesn&#39;t even care for margaritas.

ZprjkMmzdDwplR7eLv8Psg.text: Would give it a 0 star if possible. Was the worst Mexican restaurant I've ever been to. Left and ate Raman Noodles at home afterwards because it was so bad. The chips and salsa weren't even good. And the food was very blah especially for the high end price. Stay away!!!

TmFck7SjyLz4wBIDZP69-A.text: This is my favorite restaurant to go whenever I'm in Vegas. Best authentic Mexican food. Great service and friendly staff

o5hJi3ggpl0eOBdAmNY1cQ.text: I have a very close friend of the family who makes us mexican food for my birthday every year. I am worried that they may see this review, but this place truly deserves to be called the best and most authentic mexican restaurant I have ever experienced. I was here about a month ago and the live band was very talented. The shrimp dish I got came with large, fresh shrimp and the most flavorful spicy mayonnaise based sauce. They're very generous with free starter soup and endless tortilla chips. The tortillas were perfect and fresh. The bartender was knowledgable about the menu and recommended me in the right direction.

d7iJ1uFE2abZRV6Htn4xMg.text: One of my families favorites !  This is a great place for family dining although it is very loud/the in Vairo meant is very exciting and the food is fresh delicious and authentic

1nvmG4G0bRHjY74RFNiYxw.text: Waited for few minutes before our party of four got seated. I have here with me my mom, my teenage sister and a college bestfriend. Just after 5 minutes of waiting to prepare the table for us, everything we down easily. The service was accommodating and friendly.  We ordered camarones rancheros, steak ranchero for me, carne asada, and carnitas for my mom. We also waited for few minutes before the food was served. We then enjoyed our chips and guac appetizer, it's delicious and appetizing.  Our food came and we started eating, it was good and very filling. We almost finished everything in our meal and felt very satisfied with it. Portions were just enough and I am very much filled with it.  Highly recommended and we will be back.

mQP-eWurP7JwdaQ2up4l0g.text: From the moment we arrived we were treated to great service! Seated promptly... drink orders taken and brought quickly.  Extensive menu with great dishes.  Chips, salsa and fresh beans brought to us and fresh flavors on all.     Margaritas blended and cold  Sopa de fideo before our meal tasted just like my moms and the flavor was perfect!   Ordered Camarones enchiladas and enchiladas suizas with grilled chicken.  Delicious! Beautiful portions of shrimp;  the chicken in the suizas is the best I've ever had in these enchiladas. Topped with queso fresco and the creamy flavorful suiza sauce tops any enchilada suizas I've ever had !!!   Vasyn our host provided outstanding and excellent service - very quick, polite, friendly and efficient server Give this man a raise!   Lindo Michoacan we love you!

jgIJRFt_zyQAck7zPxrRcQ.text: Officially my new favorite Mexican restaurant overall! I live in Orange County and no place compares to this place in all Mexican restaurants I've been to. Granted my family comes from Michoacan and perhaps that's why everything tastes like home.  1. They start you off which chips, salsa and home made refried beans. None of that canned stuff! (Yes I know the difference)  2. Your meal comes with a traditional "sopa de fideo" which is what every Mexican kid grows up with as a child. It's like a alphabet soup but with some Latino TLC  3. The flour and corn tortillas are home made!!! How often do you see that???!!! Makes the food so much better!!  4. The restaurant has beautiful decorations of typical arts from Michoacan. Everything on the walls are representative of what a Pueblo in Michoacan sells as hand made art.  5. They have live music. There is a one man band gentlemen with his guitar or keyboard that plays great songs. You can tip him and give requests. They even let us dance to one of his songs. Not much room but we made room.  6. Pretty much anything you order is freshly made and damn good at a reasonable price! To the owners of Lindo Michoacan, you should consider opening up one in Orange County, Ca. PLEASE!!!

Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decor
Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three Tacos de Asada - They are full of meat

Cr_4XH38RkgQZ-UMvye1gg.text: Such a festive place! Definately a place to have a fun bday dinner! I had the opportunity to have dinner here with a friend. He said, the guac here is amazing because its made fresh by your table! Say what!!!   So we came here for dinner. Servings are huge. They give complimentary chips, salsa, and this amazing tomato based soup with the thinnest noodles in it! Yum! I recommend sharing a dish or come hungry!!!!  I had the beef ranchero salad. Nice portion of meat. A nice kick of spice of the dressing. Lovely salad!   My friend got a combo meal. WoW. Huge serving. Three people can eat it!  Now lets talk about the guac!!! The avocado is sliced in front of you. Garnish with lime and all the seasoning. The server will also ask how spicy you want it by the amount of jalapeno he will put in the mixer! Very entertaining to watch!!!  Around the restarurant, there are people celebrating bdays and staff are so festive doing their rounds singing to them! Bday tequilla shots too!!!  So fun! Festive. I cant wait to visit when I am in town!

Lryiqcu_qrVySLLVwGr1VA.text: The best Mexican restaurant in Las Vegas for me.  Monday through Friday they have lunch special.

E4A-gO2WheP8zONmD2ZV6w.text: We stopped for lunch in Las Vegas while on a shopping trip for nursing shoes.  We went to another DDD to expand our horizons.  The place was busy.  We were immediately seated.  They brought chips, salsa, and beans. The salsa very good, the beans...yoo-hoo. The lunch menu is affordable and has many selections.  Howard and Dawn had Beef Colorado.  I ordered the Chili Verde.  I tried the chili Colorado it was very tasty.  My Chili Verde was the best I have had to date.  The flavors were subtle and there was a lime hint that made this Chili Verde one of the best I have experienced.  There were two women making fresh tortillas.  I would advise you to try this place for yourself.  You will thank me later.

KY50PRoY2XHE_q0OUSruHg.text: MUCHO GUSTO  Quite the opposite from being a morbid hole in the wall, Lindo for many years has consistently upheld Michoacan's table service and cuisine at first class standards. While it is at your face colorful, loud and entertaining, the cuisine is wonderfully authentic Mexican. Great venue for date or get together with friends.Plenty of private lot parking. (Check out my tips too)

k3G36CxzfTUdMXZ8b6kXww.text: $5 margaritas at happy hour and a limited bar menu that's not so limited. The regular menu is HUGE! They have a massive selection of authentic dishes. I'm giving four stars because last time I went I could not hear my dining companion over the loud live music. Awesome music, just too loud for dinner. The place is quirky with tons of eye candy memorabilia to look at.

8UNn3S5mC-G-NDqYdRGd2w.text: I have visited this restaurant a few times. Each time I have never been disappointed. The atmosphere is fun, and busy. The waiters/waitresses have always been on top of everything and the food is delicious. I normally get the chicken coniac (sp) Amazing!  I'm going to have to come on my birthday, I swear they give you a full size cake or something lol. I may be exaggerating but it does look big (there were two birthdays and they go all out with the singing and guitar thingy) will def be back.

WwOSDNVOuQU7YgNDt5Teng.text: We were visiting Las Vegas and had a rental car for a few days, so we decided to have dinner somewhere off The Strip. We did a Yelp search for best Mexican restaurants and found Lindo Michoacan. I am so glad we did because it was a most delightful dinning experience.   We arrived for a relatively early dinner on a Monday and were seated immediately. The space is enormous and they also have a nice bar (which I did not visit), so even if there was a wait, I can't imagine it would be long.   We were seated at an intimate semi-circle booth. I was quickly drawn to the authentic vibe of the space - great decor and great music. Within seconds we were greeted by our waiter, who informed us about the happy hour specials. Who can say no to a margarita, especially with the happy price? Next, another staff member delivered us warm chips, salsa, and a dip (similar to refried beans). I was a fan of all three and I typically do not care for refried beans.   When I started to explore the menu, I was a bit overwhelmed. Think Cheesecake Factory. It was organized nicely into pork, chicken, beef, seafood, and combination options (enchiladas, tacos, burritos, etc). Based on comfort, I was tempted to go to the combo page and order something about which I am familiar, but I thought maybe this wasn't the best idea since it was the last page of the menu - almost an afterthought. Therefore, I enlisted the assistance of the waiter. I asked for his advice on the best camarones (shrimp) dishes. He recommended three and I decided on the Camarones Rajas Crema.   While we were ordering, someone sneak attack delivered complimentary sopa de Fideo; tasty broth with thin, short noodles. Definitely a nice start to the meal. And I am completely serious when I say I did not even see it be placed in front of me.   It didn't take long for our entrees to arrive. The Camarones Rajas Crema was visually appealing and tasted even better. There were 6-7 large shrimp, perfectly complimented with poblano peppers and onions, in a red cream sauce served with refried beans, rice, guacamole, and lettuce. The shrimp were clearly fresh and substantial in size. We had our choice of flour and corn tortillas and we decided to try both. While both were delicious, I preferred the corn.   Along with amazing food and the inviting ambiance, the service was impeccable. Everyone with whom we interacted was friendly, attentive, and dedicated to excellence.   Regarding tourists, while one could probably eat three meals a day on The Strip for a year and never eat at the same place twice, this place is worth getting off The Strip. Make the short trip, you won't regret it! Did I mention the prices were reasonable.

Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita (happy hour price makes it even more delicious)

LSxbiWgoR_oWBC5mu65mMg.text: Came in for brunch with a party of 11. We must have picked the perfect time to arrive because they were able to seat us right away and soon after they were packed! This was our first time here. The atmosphere is great, loved the decor! Our server and all the wait staff were really nice. Forgot our waters a couple times, but that would be the only negative. We started off with cheese crisps and queso fundido. Omg they were delicious! The fresh homemade tortillas were amazing! Most of us ordered the menudo and i have to say, it's some if the best menudo ive had. The horchata was delicious too. Everyone gets fideo to start, you don't even have to order it. It was really good, it reminded me of the fideo my nanas used to make.  Highly recommend coming here.

photos.caption: Photo of Lindo Michoacan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menudo

OVfqu6IWh2MMOb47z7YeAA.text: Worse service. We came based upon recommendations. I got the garlic shrimp and my bf got the fajita plate. We got a ceviche to share. The shrimp and bean dip was good, but everything went downhill from there. Two separate waiters came to help out. Both taking drink orders, failed to bring the drinks, then asked again for our order. Fast forward, my bf went to the bathroom so we thought, perfect, it's the perfect time to tell our waiter it's his birthday. Bout an hour passed, our ceviche finally arrived. It looks really boring. Sure enough, my suspicions were right. The lime juice was bitter(bad lime). The rest of the food finally followed after another 15 minutes. My shrimp plate tasted funky. The waiter forgot my sourcream and I was charged for it. My bf's fajita plate only had chicken when he ordered chicken and steak. The plate was filled with green bell peppers and onions. The chicken was plain. Our friends got their plates and ate quietly because they were so hungry and tired. Their ceviche tasted a lot better than ours and we got the same thing. It took forever to ask for limes and the waiter kept forgetting to bring our bill. We noticed they charged extra for things that they did not bring out. We told the waiter so he can make the changes. They forgot to sing happy birthday so we had to remind them. They came out and did the whole birthday thing with the free tequila shot. Overall, it could have been better, but the service and food was not cutting it. Waste of money!
